Pre-Game Insights: Flames will be looking to quickly bounce back from the 3-2 loss at home against Burundi
Both teams are aiming for their first victory in the qualifiers after dropping points in their respective opening matches
The Flames will be looking for their first-ever victory against Burkina Faso in all competitions since 2000
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will take place at Stade du 26 Mars in Bamako, Mali
Others: The Flames coach Patrick Mabedi said the boys were determined to get the first win in the qualifiers
Burkina Faso is ranked 67th in the world
Senegal moved top of Group L after beating Burundi 1-0 at Bingu National Stadium
Burundi is second with three points while Burkina Faso is third with one point. The Flames anchor Group L without a point
